headline: Mastercard posts Q4 beat as spending lift volumes, shares rise
summary: Investing.com -- Mastercard reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, as resilient consumer spending and steady international travel drove higher transaction volumes. Shares of the company rose 1.7% in premarket trading.

content.title: Mastercard posts Q4 beat as spending lift volumes, shares rise

headline: Mastercard (NYSE:MA) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Global payments technology company Mastercard (NYSE:MA) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 17.6% year on year to $8.81 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.76 per share was 12.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Mastercard (NYSE:MA) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates
content.summary: Global payments technology company Mastercard (NYSE:MA) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 17.6% year on year to $8.81 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.76 per share was 12.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Mastercard profit beats estimates on sustained consumer spending
summary: Mastercard beat Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, as resilient spending on travel, leisure and everyday ​essentials boosted transaction volumes for the payment processor. Spending has largely ‌held up despite concerns of economic uncertainty fueled by U.S. President Donald Trump's trade ‌policies, sticky inflation and a sluggish labor market. Shoppers also locked in deals to stretch their discretionary budgets during the holiday quarter, lifting transaction volumes for payment processors.

content.title: Mastercard profit beats estimates on sustained consumer spending
content.summary: Mastercard beat Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, as resilient spending on travel, leisure and everyday ​essentials boosted transaction volumes for the payment processor. Spending has largely ‌held up despite concerns of economic uncertainty fueled by U.S. President Donald Trump's trade ‌policies, sticky inflation and a sluggish labor market. Shoppers also locked in deals to stretch their discretionary budgets during the holiday quarter, lifting transaction volumes for payment processors.

headline: MasterCard: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PURCHASE, N.Y. (AP) — MasterCard Inc. MA) on Thursday reported fourth-quarter earnings of $4.06 billion. On a per-share basis, the Purchase, New York-based company said it had net income of $4.52.

content.title: MasterCard: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: PURCHASE, N.Y. (AP) — MasterCard Inc. MA) on Thursday reported fourth-quarter earnings of $4.06 billion. On a per-share basis, the Purchase, New York-based company said it had net income of $4.52.

headline: Mastercard profit exceeds expectations, set to lay off 4% globally
summary: Mastercard beat Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter profit on resilient spending, and said it will lay off ​about 4% of its global workforce to refocus investments in different ‌areas.  Shares of Mastercard ‍were up over 1.7% in early trading.  Spending has largely held up despite concerns of economic uncertainty fueled by U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies, sticky inflation and ​a sluggish labor market.

content.title: Mastercard profit exceeds expectations, set to lay off 4% globally
content.summary: Mastercard beat Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter profit on resilient spending, and said it will lay off ​about 4% of its global workforce to refocus investments in different ‌areas.  Shares of Mastercard ‍were up over 1.7% in early trading.  Spending has largely held up despite concerns of economic uncertainty fueled by U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies, sticky inflation and ​a sluggish labor market.

content.summary: PURCHASE, N.Y., January 29, 2026--Mastercard will premiere Kahan’s new music video during its 2026 Grammy Awards® commercial break and extend the experience beyond the broadcast.

thumbnail.caption: Noah Kahan on set during the filming of his music video “The Great Divide,” co produced by Mastercard in support of a larger campaign unlocking Priceless Experiences and premium access to his music through The Mastercard Collection on January 29, 2026, in Nashville, Tennessee.

headline: Mastercard to Cut 4% of Full-Time Employees After Business Review
summary: Mastercard  said it plans to cut 4% of its roughly 35,000 employees and book a $200 million restructuring charge, becoming the latest in a series of companies that have announced job cuts in recent days.  The move follows a recent strategic review of its business, Chief Financial Officer  Sachin Mehra  said on a call with analysts Thursday.  “We expect these actions will free up capacity to further invest in our strategic priorities and best position us to continue to execute on our growth algorithm,” Mehra said.

content.title: Mastercard to Cut 4% of Full-Time Employees After Business Review
content.summary: Mastercard  said it plans to cut 4% of its roughly 35,000 employees and book a $200 million restructuring charge, becoming the latest in a series of companies that have announced job cuts in recent days.  The move follows a recent strategic review of its business, Chief Financial Officer  Sachin Mehra  said on a call with analysts Thursday.  “We expect these actions will free up capacity to further invest in our strategic priorities and best position us to continue to execute on our growth algorithm,” Mehra said.
